sect2.title: Introduction
sect2.para: Wolframe transactions are defined as functions in a transactional context. The begin and the commit or abort are done automatically at the begin or at the end of a transaction function respectively, if not explicitely defined otherwise in the scripting language. For the description of transactions Wolframe provides the definition language introduce here. A transaction takes a structure as input and returns a structure as output.

The transaction definition language defines a transaction as a sequence of database operations. A database operation is either a single database instruction (SELECT,UPDATE,etc.) or a name reference to a prepared statement or a block of operations delared with OPERATION. It adds some constructs to address input structure elements or database command results as arguments. Each database command result can be declared as beeing part of the transaction result structure. The language has no control structures and is therefore not a general purpose programming language. It just offers some direct mapping of input to commands and from commands results to output. For programming Wolframe offers some scripting language bindings to use outside the transactional context.

sect2.title: First example
sect2.para: This example selects a key from a table and uses it for a list inserts. The substitute "$1" refers to the first column of the "SELECT id FROM UserTable .." query result. The substitute "$(name)" refers to the "name" element of the "item" selection in the query, e.g. for each element with the path "/item/name" (name beeing unique per item and item describing a set of items).

simplelist.member: TRANSACTION
Defines a block of statements as transaction.
OPERATION
Defines a block of statements as single operation.
BEGIN
Marks the start of an execution block defined as TRANSACTION or OPERATION. Execution blocks cannot be nested
END
Marks the end of an execution block.
RESULT INTO
Followed by a tag defining an outer tag in the result of the execution block.
AUTHORIZE
Followed by a pair of identifiers in '(' ')' brackets, separated by a comma. Defines the method to call for granting authorization to the caller of this transaction.
FOREACH

Followed by a selection path. Defines a selection in nodes of the input. The operation is executed for each member of the selection. All relative path expressions in the operation arguments have the path of the selected element of the operation as base.
INTO
Followed by an identifier that declares the result tag for each result element of this operation
DO
Starts the operation declaration. It is followed by an embedded SQL command terminated with ';' or by an operation call
UNIQUE
constraint on operation result: Result must be unique, if it exists
NONEMPTY
constraint on operation result: Result must not be empty
